Only English issue supported. The answer is no, we don't do that. You can change the codes and do that for yourself.
If you want to connect localhost, why do you change the application.yml? And using your real IP address?

Your collector didn't set up right. Follow documents and logs.
thanks
I prefer you could send a pr to fix this. The core team is pretty busy.
This is an easy network error. Grpc connection can't establish. Check your setting, network, and firewall.

I run agent on collector‘s  localhost，my java start command：
java -jar -Dapp.id=osmc-sms-service -Djava.ext.dirs=../agent/skywalking-agent.jar -Denv=DEV -Dserver.port=2225 -Ddev_meta=http://10.128.190.47:8080 -javaagent:../agent/skywalking-agent.jar -Dskywalking.agent.application_code=osmc-sms-service -Dskywalking.collector.servers=10.128.190.18:10800 -Dapollo.cluster=default target/osmc-sms-service.jar
Are you using ipv6? That is totally a different thing in Java. I have no env to verify that. The easy way is, you use the grpc quick-start demo to test the network on your local machine.

I find the reason：
I have default proxy env 。-DproxyHost=10.128.90.133 -DproxyPort=3122。
removed，it work ok！
We don't support that.
Will it be supported later？ @wu-sheng
That is not a part of roadmap. It is meaningless.

I use TomCat has the same error ,I use Spring Cloud Version : Dalston.SR3
and I  use **ctripcorp/apollo** as config server
You shoud use master codes, it is fixed yesterday.
We need your os, jdk or anything else. We and others in community can work.

The build doc is used by the whole community. Please follow all steps. And use good network env. This is a big project, which you need a lot of things.
@wu-sheng I expected there is alot of files being involved. the good timing to do such task is just before release the software and after code has been freezed
@zone1511 Agree. But you should understand, we have a lot of plans to do. So not sure who will do this. So I hope you could contribute the style file changes, one for each time.

This is not about connection. This fail means, your elastic search table(type) existed, but don't include the right field(column). Most likely, you have used this es for the early version and didn't clear that.

@shipengyan This error means, for example, you used to use SkyWalking alpha, then use the same es in beta/beta2.
Repeat submit , shut down

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11549125/43142020-ff2e63e8-8f89-11e8-812d-b695b373a20d.png)

i tried to create a project without importing our company jars but failed to repro this issue. but in my local environment i can debug and repro this issue. please see my attachment. it seems the allArguments[2] is null sometimes. so we need to check it first

upload the source 
![springmvc-demo-master 7z](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41441811/43170148-7d0e5b14-8fd6-11e8-9003-e45fb5dcee65.jpg)

remove the .jpg

Well, I gonna use official [Java library](https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java) to access API server in pods.
As discussed before, there should be an 'id'(previous version use `ip:host`) to identify which of the node lists is itself. I prefer to use `metadata.uid` provided by [downward api](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/environment-variable-expose-pod-information/#the-downward-api).

@Yuanxiangz I am not following. `entryOperationName` should have a `#` prefix in the header. But the carrier has already done this by `ContextCarrier#setParentOperationName`. Are you doing anything, which misses this method when process the header?
@oatiz What is the status of this PR? Still active?
See https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1420 . Fixed.

Thanks sheng, I have found the error reason. it's not a skywalking issue. In our test env we use a prefix to tell the different. for the same rocketmq topic like OrderDiffQueue in our T2 env, the topic name will be "T2|OrderDiffQueue". in that case, when skywalking use "|" to split the text will get a wrong result. i will fix it in my private branch to replace "|" in topic to "/". For your question, I have thought the deserialize method's input, the parts[5] may be not start with "#" in some cases.
I see. Thanks for your explanation. @ascrutae What do you use for carrier propagation? Why does this affect the topic name?

org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.configuration.service.ComponentLibraryCatalogService
and the file name is  **_incubator-skywalking\apm-collector\apm-collector-configuration\collector-configuration-provider\src\test\resources\component-libraries.yml_**

> But I still could not solve the problem.Is there any help?

There are two easy ways:
1. Package master codes
1. `Git Cherry-pick` the pull request commit to the tag head. Then recompile. I recommend this because it is safer.
I use the `Message#UserProperty` to propagate the trace context. and we didn't change any property of the message in this plugin

> I use the Message#UserProperty to propagate the trace context. and we didn't change any property of the message in this plugin

I thought in that way too. @Yuanxiangz Could you provide more info? What do you have this problem?

ElasticSearch 6 will not be supported in SkyWalking v6. FYI @peng-yongsheng 

We have no roadmap to do that in v5 series.
Of source, we will not stop anyone to contribute that feature. You even can provide a new repo and storage plugin to support that.

@wu-sheng Hi,sir.I recompiled from tag 5.0.0-beta2 .But it showed some error message when I make PHP(molten,a php-agent for Zipkin ) test.
Here is the message from  skywalking-collector-server.log:

![skywalkingerror](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27755589/43238096-44a94902-90bf-11e8-96a3-be04ff4da1cf.jpg)



And here is another message which  use ZipKin Brave+Java agent in test:


![javaerror](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27755589/43238103-4ac2690e-90bf-11e8-97ca-3e730b1bd731.jpg)

> I recompiled from tag 5.0.0-beta2

Have you `cherry-pick` the pr I pointed to you?
@wu-sheng I didn‘t do that.I use git checkout . I recompiled follow ur document (https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/How-to-build.md)

> I didn‘t do that.I use git checkout .

That recompile is meaningless. The tag is exactly the codes you downloaded. You need cherry-pick
@wu-sheng I try what u told me to do(use git cherry-pick).But the error message still show again .
@ascrutae hi Xin, is the information enough to fix it?
any idea?
Only English, please. SImple answer, no, except you access from other monitored services. Then you will receive alerts.
@ZhaoRuidong I checked the topology data, something wrong about the application reference index, I need to check the segment, but there is no data in segment index.
@ZhaoRuidong Can you upload a new es data contains segment data?

That shouldn't. Are you sure you are using the latest codes about this? Honest, I am not quite sure about this. Do you have any Java programmer at your sides? Could you do some debug to output the data you received?

Thank you @wu-sheng !
Do you think I can now also submit a pull request with the badge for the web site?

> Do you think I can now also submit a pull request with the badge for the web site?

I am still thinking about using a new template for our website. Just didn't find a good one. I am just not sure whether is a good time for you to update.
